entry.title: How to Install Mitmproxy on El Capitan
entry.content:
Charles is nice, but sometimes it’s not an option – for licensing issues, for example.

A good alternative is mitmproxy. It’s free, and it does the job well.

To install on El Capitan:

  1. If you don’t have pip installed: sudo easy_install pip
  2. sudo pip install mitmproxy

  3. At this point, running mitmproxy produces this error:

     asdasdasd

  4. Bullet 4
